text: Since reopening our offices to the public and resuming in-person services on June 4, our top priority has been to resume naturalization ceremonies for those whose ceremonies were postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Yesterday, Deputy Director for Policy Edlow addressed the @HouseJudiciary Committee Subcommittee on Immigration and announced that we have now completed all pending oaths that were put on hold due to COVID-19.

Thank you to @CabrilloNPS for hosting us this month as we led 134 candidates in the Oath of Allegiance to become #NewUScitizens! The national monument was a great venue to allow proper social distancing to keep our staff and the public safe and healthy. Congrats to all! https://t.co/H0gRxRVlB6
